page.title: 04Organisations
page.content: In this area there are two main organisations,the SWRI-Scottish Womens Rural Institute and the Men's Club.The Men's club started in 1916 as a bothy club down at the crossroads until Rathillet Hall was built in 1923 .This club meets on a Thursday all the year round except in the summer when the men are too busy on the farms.Members of this club play games such as pool, billiards, bowls, table-tennis and darts.The population on the whole has dropped and there is nothing like the same number of people living in this area that used to and so this is why the number of members in the WRI and the Men's Club has also dropped. Children can go to the Boys ,Brigade, Brownies, Guides, Cubs or Scouts, but these are in Cupar, Newport or Wormit. The nearest Country Dance class is at Gauldry.
